properties.name: Alan Wong's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl561857 S. King St., Honolulu, HIWaikiki and Beyond - the shrine of Hawaiian regional cuisine.

properties.name: Albuquerque's Balloon Fiesta
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl569201 Balloon Museum Dr NE, Albuquerque, NM The World\'s Most Photographed Event - 9 days in early October.

properties.name: Alhambra, Generalife and Albayzín, Granada
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Rising above the modern lower town, the Alhambra and the Albaycín, situated on two adjacent hills, form the medieval part of Granada. To the east of the Alhambra fortress and residence are the magnificent gardens of the Generalife, the former rural residence of the emirs who ruled this part of Spain in the 13th and 14th centuries. The residential district of the Albaycín is a rich repository of Moorish vernacular architecture, into which the traditional Andalusian architecture blends harmoniously.

properties.name: Alto Douro Wine Region
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Wine has been produced by traditional landholders in the Alto Douro region for some 2,000 years. Since the 18th century, its main product, port wine, has been world famous for its quality. This long tradition of viticulture has produced a cultural landscape of outstanding beauty that reflects its technological, social and economic evolution.

properties.name: Amelia Island - The Palace Saloon
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56117 Centre Street, Fernandina Beach, FL 32034"Bypassed by Time, Sweetened by Modern-Day Luxury"- Amelia Island- island, town, hotel. Best time - Shrimp Festival, 1st weekend in May.

properties.name: Amelia Island - The Ritz-Carlton
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl564750 Amelia Island Parkway, Amelia Island, FL 32034"Bypassed by Time, Sweetened by Modern-Day Luxury" - island, town, hotel (from 59-59). Restaurant - The Grill (0). Best time is the 1st weekend in May for the Shrimp Festival.

properties.name: Aranjuez Cultural Landscape
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The Aranjuez cultural landscape is an entity of complex relationships: between nature and human activity, between sinuous watercourses and geometric landscape design, between the rural and the urban, between forest landscape and the delicately modulated architecture of its palatial buildings. Three hundred years of royal attention to the development and care of this landscape have seen it express an evolution of concepts from humanism and political centralization, to characteristics such as those found in its 18th century French-style Baroque garden, to the urban lifestyle which developed alongside the sciences of plant acclimatization and stock-breeding during the Age of Enlightenment.

properties.name: Archaeological Ensemble of Mérida
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The colony of Augusta Emerita, which became present-day Mérida in Estremadura, was founded in 25 B.C. at the end of the Spanish Campaign and was the capital of Lusitania. The well-preserved remains of the old city include, in particular, a large bridge over the Guadiana, an amphitheatre, a theatre, a vast circus and an exceptional water-supply system. It is an excellent example of a provincial Roman capital during the empire and in the years afterwards.

properties.name: Archaeological Ensemble of Tárraco
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Tárraco (modern-day Tarragona) was a major administrative and mercantile city in Roman Spain and the centre of the Imperial cult for all the Iberian provinces. It was endowed with many fine buildings, and parts of these have been revealed in a series of exceptional excavations. Although most of the remains are fragmentary, many preserved beneath more recent buildings, they present a vivid picture of the grandeur of this Roman provincial capital.

properties.name: Archaeological Site of Atapuerca
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The caves of the Sierra de Atapuerca contain a rich fossil record of the earliest human beings in Europe, from nearly one million years ago and extending up to the Common Era. They represent an exceptional reserve of data, the scientific study of which provides priceless information about the appearance and the way of life of these remote human ancestors.

properties.name: Arizona Biltmore Resort & Spa
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl562400 E. Missouri Ave., Phoenix, AZA Wrightian Legend - The only surviving hotel in the world in whose design Frank Lloyd Wright participated.

properties.name: Arocs de la Frontera
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1000 - Home Base for Andalusia\'s Pueblos Blancos -town (Arcos de la Fontera) -Hotel (Parador Casa del Corregidor) -Excursions to whitewashed villages along the Ruta de los Pueblos Blancos -Ronda, home of bullfighting

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl561727 Brooklyn Avenue, Kansas City, MOA Nationally Acclaimed Culinary Landmark, open at 10:00 a.m.

properties.name: Beaulieu Vineyard
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1960 St. Helena Hwy., Rutherford, CANot so much a winery as a tasting room next to Rutherford Grill. No ambience, but the wine is cheap, there are coupons online, and they accept walk-in tastings. Go here if you\'re looking to put more alcohol in your system.

properties.name: Blackberry Farm
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl561471 West Millers Cove Road, Walland, TN 37886"High Style in the Smokies"- hotel, restaurant. 45-845, including meals. Best times Oct-Nov for foliage.

properties.name: Burgos Cathedral
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Our Lady of Burgos was begun in the 13th century at the same time as the great cathedrals of the Ile-de-France and was completed in the 15th and 16th centuries. The entire history of Gothic art is summed up in its superb architecture and its unique collection of works of art, including paintings, choir stalls, reredos, tombs and stained-glass windows.

properties.name: Bussaco Forest
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Mata Nacional do Bussaco, Coimbra, Portugal 1000 - A Sylvan Setting for A Pleasure Palace Turned Hotel -site (Bussaco Forest) -hotel (Palace Hotel do Bussaco)

properties.name: Cadaques
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Cadaques, Spain1000 - Quaint and Charming Haunts of Artists and Intellectuals

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 8300 St. Helena Hwy., Rutherford, CAGood wine; requires reservations. They are sticklers about having reservations and showing up on time. Definitely a rare uptight Napa experience.

properties.name: Canyon Ranch Health Resort
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl568600 E. Rockcliff Road, Tucson, AZA World-Class Wellness Center - a pioneer among co-ed fitness resorts in the U.S.

properties.name: Canyon de Chelly National Monument
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56Sacred Outdoor Museum of the Navajo Nation - best known for its multi-storied cliffside dwellings built by the Anasazi between 700-1300 AD.

properties.name: Canyon de Chelly National Monument - Thunderbird Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56Sacred Outdoor Museum of the Navajo Nation - The only accomodations officially within the park

properties.name: Carlsbad Caverns National Park
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56A Natural Subterranean Wonder - Best time is mid-May to Mid-Oct for the bats.

properties.name: Castello di Amorosa
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 4045 N. St. Helena Hwy., Calistoga, CA 94515A little corporate and reminiscent of Medieval Times, but still an impressive and beatiful spot. Great views and a lot of character, albiet manufactured. Wine was adequate. Our particular pourer was surly.

properties.name: Catalan National Art Museum
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Parc de Montjuïc 08038 Barcelona1000 - An Unsurpassed Collection of Romanesque Art -site (Museum)

properties.name: Catalan Romanesque Churches of the Vall de Boí
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The narrow Vall de Boí is situated in the high Pyrénées, in the Alta Ribagorça region and is surrounded by steep mountains. Each village in the valley contains a Romanesque church, and is surrounded by a pattern of enclosed fields. There are extensive seasonally-used grazing lands on the higher slopes.

properties.name: Cathedral, Alcázar and Archivo de Indias in    Seville
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Together these three buildings form a remarkable monumental complex in the heart of Seville. The cathedral and the Alcázar – dating from the Reconquest of 1248 to the 16th century and imbued with Moorish influences – are an exceptional testimony to the civilization of the Almohads as well as that of Christian Andalusia. The Giralda minaret is the masterpiece of Almohad architecture. It stands next to the cathedral with its five naves; the largest Gothic building in Europe, it houses the tomb of Christopher Columbus. The ancient Lonja, which became the Archivo de Indias, contains valuable documents from the archives of the colonies in the Americas.

properties.name: Cattlemen's Steakhouse
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl561309 S. Agnew, Oklahoma City, OK 73108Where Beef Reigns - In the middle of OK National Stockyards; have the corn-fed sirloin steak.

properties.name: Cave of Altamira and Paleolithic Cave Art of Northern Spain
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Seventeen decorated caves of the Paleolithic age were inscribed as an extension to the Altamira Cave, inscribed in 1985. The property will now appear on the List as Cave of Altamira and Paleolithic Cave Art of Northern Spain. The property represents the apogee of Paleolithic cave art that developed across Europe, from the Urals to the Iberian Peninusula, from 35,000 to 11,000 BC. Because of their deep galleries, isolated from external climatic influences, these caves are particularly well preserved. The caves are inscribed as masterpieces of creative genius and as the humanity’s earliest accomplished art. They are also inscribed as exceptional testimonies to a cultural tradition and as outstanding illustrations of a significant stage in human history.

properties.name: Central Zone of the Town of Angra do Heroismo in the Azores
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Situated on one of the islands in the Azores archipelago, this was an obligatory port of call from the 15th century until the advent of the steamship in the 19th century. The 400-year-old San Sebastião and San João Baptista fortifications are unique examples of military architecture. Damaged by an earthquake in 1980, Angra is now being restored.

properties.name: Chez Panisse
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl561517 Shattuck Avenue, Berkeley, CA, 94709"The Restaurant That Changed the Way America Eats"- restaurant. Alice Waters. Closed Sunday.

properties.name: Chez Panisse- Zuni Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1658 Market Street, San Francisco, CA"The Restaurant That Changed the Way America Eats"- briefly mentioned as similar to Chez Panisse. Closed Monday.

properties.name: Convent of Christ in Tomar
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Originally designed as a monument symbolizing the Reconquest, the Convent of the Knights Templar of Tomar (transferred in 1344 to the Knights of the Order of Christ) came to symbolize just the opposite during the Manueline period – the opening up of Portugal to other civilizations.

properties.name: Cultural Landscape of Sintra
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 In the 19th century Sintra became the first centre of European Romantic architecture. Ferdinand II turned a ruined monastery into a castle where this new sensitivity was displayed in the use of Gothic, Egyptian, Moorish and Renaissance elements and in the creation of a park blending local and exotic species of trees. Other fine dwellings, built along the same lines in the surrounding serra, created a unique combination of parks and gardens which influenced the development of landscape architecture throughout Europe.

properties.name: Death Valley National Park
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Death Valley, CA 92328"As Low as You Can Get" - site, hotel. 0 per car. Best times Oct-May; dawn and late afternoon for the visual power and play of light.

properties.name: Death Valley National Park - Furnace Creek Inn
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56  "As Low as You Can Get"- site, hotel. Historic inn in death valley. Rates 55-65. Best times Oct-May.

properties.name: Delfina
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 3621 18th St, San FranciscoPork sugo with pappardelle

properties.name: Diamond Head
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Waikiki and Beyond - Requisite tourist activity, great view of Honolulu.

properties.name: Diamond Oaks Vineyard
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1595 Oakville Grade, Oakville, CA 94562Absolutely amazing spot for a picnic, and wine is good too. We always take out of town visitors here. The view, combined with a relaxed and inviting feel, never fail to blow them away.

properties.name: Domaine Carneros Winery
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1240 Duhig Road, Napa California 94559 Champers--youd\' think you couldn\'t go wrong, right? The winery is beautiful upon approach but very corporate and underwhelming once inside. We were ushered up to an upstairs room where, frankly, it felt like we were tasting in a funeral home. Plus, there were lines on the glass and the pourer didn\'t go a speck beyond.

properties.name: Domaine Chandon
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1 California Drive, Yountville, CA Large and rather corporate, but beautiful grounds and great champagne. Great beginning or ending to a day of tasting.

properties.name: Donana National Park
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Doñana National Park in Andalusia occupies the right bank of the Guadalquivir river at its estuary on the Atlantic Ocean. It is notable for the great diversity of its biotopes, especially lagoons, marshlands, fixed and mobile dunes, scrub woodland and maquis. It is home to five threatened bird species. It is one of the largest heronries in the Mediterranean region and is the wintering site for more than 500,000 water fowl each year.

properties.name: Elizabeth on 37th
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56105 East 37th street, savannah, georgia"The Queen of New Southern Cooking" - restaurant; open daily, dinner only (0). Try the Savannah cream cake or the peach and blueberry cobbler.

properties.name: Everglades National Park
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 107 Camellia Street, Everglades City, FL 34139"America\'s Big Swamp" - site, experience. Best way to see is by kayak or canoe. Best times Jan-Mar.

properties.name: Figueres
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Figueres, Spain1000 - Quaint and Charming Haunts of Artists and Intellectuals -town (Figueres) -restaurant (Restaurant Emporda) -site (Teatre-Museu Dali)

properties.name: Garajonay National Park
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Laurel forest covers some 70% of this park, situated in the middle of the island of La Gomera in the Canary Islands archipelago. The presence of springs and numerous streams assures a lush vegetation resembling that of the Tertiary, which, due to climatic changes, has largely disappeared from southern Europe.

properties.name: Graceland and the Elvis Trail - Beale Street
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56Beale Street, Memphis, TN"There\'s No Place Like Home"- site, hotel. Delta blues music scene. Best times: Jan 8 for Elvis\' birthday, the week around August 16 (anniversary of his death), early May for the 3 day Beale Street Music Festival.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl563765 Elvis Presley Blvd., Memphis, TN 38116"There\'s No Place Like Home"- site, hotel. Mon-Sat 9am-5pm, Sun 10am-4pm; 0.

properties.name: Graceland and the Elvis Trail - Heartbreak Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 3677 Elvis Presley Blvd., Memphis, TN 38116"There\'s No Place Like Home"- site, hotel. From 10.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56706 Union Avenue, Memphis, TN "There\'s No Place Like Home"- site, hotel. Where Elvis cut his first record. Open daily from 10am-6pm. Tours are given every half hour, .50/person.

properties.name: Guggenheim Museum Bilbao
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1000 - A Masterwork of Architectural Sculpture -site (museum)

properties.name: Halekulani
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl562199 Kalia Rd., Honolulu, HIWaikiki and Beyond - The premier hotel in the Hawaiian Islands and one of the best in the U.S. Restaurants: La Mer (great dinner), Orchids (brunch), House Without A Key (beachside- good for sunset)

properties.name: Hanauma Bay
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56Waikiki and Beyond - The best snorkeling in all the Hawaiian Islands

properties.name: Historic Centre of Cordoba
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Cordoba\'s period of greatest glory began in the 8th century after the Moorish conquest, when some 300 mosques and innumerable palaces and public buildings were built to rival the splendours of Constantinople, Damascus and Baghdad. In the 13th century, under Ferdinand III, the Saint, Cordoba\'s Great Mosque was turned into a cathedral and new defensive structures, particularly the Alcázar de los Reyes Cristianos and the Torre Fortaleza de la Calahorra, were erected.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Guimarães
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The historic town of Guimarães is associated with the emergence of the Portuguese national identity in the 12th century. An exceptionally well-preserved and authentic example of the evolution of a medieval settlement into a modern town, its rich building typology exemplifies the specific development of Portuguese architecture from the 15th to 19th century through the consistent use of traditional building materials and techniques.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Oporto
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The city of Oporto, built along the hillsides overlooking the mouth of the Douro river, is an outstanding urban landscape with a 2,000-year history. Its continuous growth, linked to the sea (the Romans gave it the name Portus, or port), can be seen in the many and varied monuments, from the cathedral with its Romanesque choir, to the neoclassical Stock Exchange and the typically Portuguese Manueline-style Church of Santa Clara.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Évora
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 This museum-city, whose roots go back to Roman times, reached its golden age in the 15th century, when it became the residence of the Portuguese kings. Its unique quality stems from the whitewashed houses decorated with azulejos and wrought-iron balconies dating from the 16th to the 18th century. Its monuments had a profound influence on Portuguese architecture in Brazil.

properties.name: Historic City of Toledo
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Successively a Roman municipium, the capital of the Visigothic Kingdom, a fortress of the Emirate of Cordoba, an outpost of the Christian kingdoms fighting the Moors and, in the 16th century, the temporary seat of supreme power under Charles V, Toledo is the repository of more than 2,000 years of history. Its masterpieces are the product of heterogeneous civilizations in an environment where the existence of three major religions – Judaism, Christianity and Islam – was a major factor.

properties.name: Historic Walled Town of Cuenca
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Built by the Moors in a defensive position at the heart of the Caliphate of Cordoba, Cuenca is an unusually well-preserved medieval fortified city. Conquered by the Castilians in the 12th century, it became a royal town and bishopric endowed with important buildings, such as Spain\'s first Gothic cathedral, and the famous casas colgadas (hanging houses), suspended from sheer cliffs overlooking the Huécar river. Taking full advantage of its location, the city towers above the magnificent countryside.

properties.name: Hollywood - Grauman's Chinese Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 6925 Hollywood Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028"Where America Invents Itself"- site. Historic theatre- where the footprints and handprints of the stars are.

properties.name: Hollywood - Hollywood Boulevard Walk of Fame
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56"Where America Invents Itself"- site. Mile-long walk honoring over 2,000 stars from 1960 on.

properties.name: Hollywood - Hotel Bel Air
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 701 Stone Canyon Road, Los Angeles, CA 90077"Where America Invents Itself"- hotel. The city\'s finest and most nostalgic venue.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56176 North Canon Drive, Beverly Hills, CA 90210"Where America Invents Itself"- restaurant. Wolfgang Puck\'s signature pizzas. Open Mon-Sat for lunch and Every night for dinner.

properties.name: Hollywood - Spago
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56176 North Canon Drive, Beverly Hills, CA 90210

properties.name: Hollywood - Walt Disney Concert Hall
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 135 North Grand Avenue. Los Angeles, CA 90012"Where America Invents Itself"- site. Home of L.A. Philharmonic; designed by Frank Gehry.

properties.name: Hollywood- Musso & Frank Grill
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl566667 Hollywood Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028"Where America Invents Itself"- restaurant. L.A.\'s oldest restaurant. Have a martini at the bar. Open Tues-Sat 11am-11pm.

properties.name: Hollywood- The Ivy
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56113 N Robertson Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90048"Where America Invents Itself"- restaurant. Outdoor lunch with great star-spotting potential. Open daily.

properties.name: Home
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl5628 Collier Road NW, #1, Atlanta, GA 30309

properties.name: Hotel Del Coronado
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1500 Orange Avenue, Coronado, CA 92118"A Beachside Dowager"- hotel, experience. Largest oceanfront resort on Pacific Coast, lots of history. Doubles from 90.

properties.name: Hotel Del Coronado- Coronado Beach
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56   Ocean Boulevard, San Diego, CA"A Beachside Dowager"- site. Great beach.

properties.name: Hotel Del Coronado- San Diego Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 2920 Zoo Drive, San Diego, CA 92112

properties.name: Hotel Del Coronado- San Diego Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 2920 Zoo Drive, San Diego, CA 92112"A Beachside Dowager"- site. World-famous zoo, animals in naturalistic habitats. 3 adult. Fall hours 8am-4pm.

properties.name: Ibiza, Biodiversity and Culture
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Ibiza provides an excellent example of the interaction between the marine and coastal ecosystems. The dense prairies of oceanic Posidonia (seagrass), an important endemic species found only in the Mediterranean basin, contain and support a diversity of marine life. Ibiza preserves considerable evidence of its long history. The archaeological sites at Sa Caleta (settlement) and Puig des Molins (necropolis) testify to the important role played by the island in the Mediterranean economy in protohistory, particularly during the Phoenician-Carthaginian period. The fortified Upper Town (Alta Vila) is an outstanding example of Renaissance military architecture; it had a profound influence on the development of fortifications in the Spanish settlements of the New World.

properties.name: Ihilani Resort and Spa
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl5692-1001 Olani Street, Oahu, Hawaii 96707 Waikiki and Beyond - The best escape from big-city glamour, with a roster of 5-star amenities.

properties.name: Inn of the Anasazi
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56113 Washington Avenue, Santa Fe, NMEarthy Elegance Inspired by the "Ancient Ones" - hotel and restaurant.

properties.name: Iowa State Fair
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56Carnival, Festival, and Feast: America\'s Most Famous Ag-Extravaganza. 11 days in mid-August.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 6740 Washington Street, Yountville CANot on a vineyard, but nice tasting room and the tastings are FREE! Pourers are really nice and wine is passable.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl5611 Washington Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139"A South Beach Institution" - restaurant. Have the stone crab and the Key lime pie. Open daily, mid-Oct to mid-May; 0.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 907 Whitehead Street, Key West, FL 33040"The Charm and Color of America\'s Last Resort" - island, hotel. Museum open every day 9am-5pm. 1.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl561 Whitehead Street, Key West, FL 33040"The Charm and Color of America\'s Last Resort" - island, hotel. Shopping and tourist attractions. Best time is at sunset.

properties.name: La Catedral de Toledo
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 RECAREDO 24, 45004 TOLEDO, SPAIN1000 - Fascinating Confluence of Three Cultures -town (Toledo) -site (Cathedral) -hotel & restaurant (Hostal del Cardenal)

properties.name: La Lonja de la Seda de Valencia
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Built between 1482 and 1533, this group of buildings was originally used for trading in silk (hence its name, the Silk Exchange) and it has always been a centre for commerce. It is a masterpiece of late Gothic architecture. The grandiose Sala de Contratación (Contract or Trading Hall), in particular, illustrates the power and wealth of a major Mediterranean mercantile city in the 15th and 16th centuries.

properties.name: La Taqueria
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 2889 Mission Street, San Francisco, CACarnitas taco

properties.name: Lake Powell
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56A Grand Canyon Filled with Water - America\'s houseboating destination- best equipped marina is Wahweap Marina. Rainbow Bridge is 50 lake miles from Wahweap Marina.

properties.name: Landscape of the Pico Island Vineyard Culture
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56  The 987-ha site on the volcanic island of Pico, the second largest in the Azores archipelago, consists of a remarkable pattern of spaced-out, long linear walls running inland from, and parallel to, the rocky shore. The walls were built to protect the thousands of small, contiguous, rectangular plots (currais) from wind and seawater. Evidence of this viniculture, whose origins date back to the 15th century, is manifest in the extraordinary assembly of the fields, in houses and early 19th-century manor houses, in wine-cellars, churches and ports. The extraordinarily beautiful man-made landscape of the site is the best remaining area of a once much more widespread practice.

properties.name: Lanikai
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56Waikiki and Beyond - Considered one of the best beaches in America, along with Kailua to the west (a classic windsurfing spot)

properties.name: Las Médulas
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 In the 1st century A.D. the Roman Imperial authorities began to exploit the gold deposits of this region in north-west Spain, using a technique based on hydraulic power. After two centuries of working the deposits, the Romans withdrew, leaving a devastated landscape. Since there was no subsequent industrial activity, the dramatic traces of this remarkable ancient technology are visible everywhere as sheer faces in the mountainsides and the vast areas of tailings, now used for agriculture.

properties.name: Laurisilva of Madeira
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The Laurisilva of Madeira is an outstanding relict of a previously widespread laurel forest type. It is the largest surviving area of laurel forest and is believed to be 90% primary forest. It contains a unique suite of plants and animals, including many endemic species such as the Madeiran long-toed pigeon.

properties.name: Leon
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1000 - A Most Unusual Cathedral and a Shelter for Knights -town (Leon) -site (Leon\'s Gothic cathedral, Cathedral Museum) -hotel (Parador San Marcos)

properties.name: Little Palm Island
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl5628500 Overseas Hwy, Little Torch Key, FL"A Sybaritic South Seas Fantasy" - island, hotel. Doubles from 95-050, includes boat transfer from Little Torch Key, beach and watercraft amenities. Best times Jan-May for weather, Jun-Oct for fishing.

properties.name: Little Palm Island - Looe Key National Marine Sanctuary
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl5627340 Overseas Hwy, Ramrod Key, FL 33042"A Sybaritic South Seas Fantasy" - island, hotel. This is the last living coral reef in North America - snorkeling/diving. Best times Jan-May for weather; Jun-Oct for fishing.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Estrada Monumental 139, 9000-098 Funchal, Madeira, Portugal1000 - Pearl of the Atlantic -island -hotel (Reid\'s Palace)

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 149 Union Avenue, Memphis, TN 38103"Pork Capital of America"- restaurant, event. See the parade of ducks every day at 11am or 5pm.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl5652 South Second St., Memphis, TN"Pork Capital of America"- restaurant, event. Grilled, dry-rubbed ribs. Closed Sun and Mon; 5. Best time: Memphis in May

properties.name: Meson de Candido
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Azoguejo 5, Segovia, Spain1000 - King of Spain\'s Culinary Gem -town (Segovia - includes Alcazar which Snow White palace is based on, Acueducto Romano, 16th Century Gothic cathedral) -restaurant (Meson de Candido)

properties.name: Miner Family Vineyards
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 7850 Silverado Trail, Oakville CAGood solid choice- wine is good and pretty good views.

properties.name: Monastery and Site of the Escurial, Madrid
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Built at the end of the 16th century on a plan in the form of a grill, the instrument of the martyrdom of St Lawrence, the Escurial Monastery stands in an exceptionally beautiful site in Castile. Its austere architecture, a break with previous styles, had a considerable influence on Spanish architecture for more than half a century. It was the retreat of a mystic king and became, in the last years of Philip II\'s reign, the centre of the greatest political power of the time.

properties.name: Monastery of Alcobaça
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The Monastery of Santa Maria d\'Alcobaça, north of Lisbon, was founded in the 12th century by King Alfonso I. Its size, the purity of its architectural style, the beauty of the materials and the care with which it was built make this a masterpiece of Cistercian Gothic art.

properties.name: Monastery of Batalha
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The Monastery of the Dominicans of Batalha was built to commemorate the victory of the Portuguese over the Castilians at the battle of Aljubarrota in 1385. It was to be the Portuguese monarchy\'s main building project for the next two centuries. Here a highly original, national Gothic style evolved, profoundly influenced by Manueline art, as demonstrated by its masterpiece, the Royal Cloister.

properties.name: Monastery of the Hieronymites and Tower of Belém in    Lisbon
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56  Standing at the entrance to Lisbon harbour, the Monastery of the Hieronymites – construction of which began in 1502 – exemplifies Portuguese art at its best. The nearby Tower of Belém, built to commemorate Vasco da Gama\'s expedition, is a reminder of the great maritime discoveries that laid the foundations of the modern world.

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - 17-Mile Drive
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl561700 17-Mile Drive, Pacific Grove, CA 93950"Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- experience. One of the most stunning roads on either U.S. seaboard. Toll road.

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - Carmel Mission
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl563080 Rio Road, Carmel, CA 93923"Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- site. Historic HQ for entire mission system in CA. Mission tours from 9:30am-5pm, .

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - Carmel-by-the-Sea
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56"Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- site. Cute town.

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - Hog's Breath Inn
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 San Carlos St & 5th Ave, Carmel, CA 93923"Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- restaurant. Fun for a Dirty Harry Burger or a nightcap.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl5626270 Dolores Street, Carmel, CA 93923"Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- hotel, restaurant. Stay for dinner at the ranch dining room. From 00 for hotel.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56886 Cannery Row, Monterey, CA 93940"Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- site. 4.95/adult. 9:30am-6pm M-F, 9:30am-8pm Sat and Sun during summer.

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - Monterey Jazz Festival
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl562000 Fairground Road, Monterey, CA

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - Old Monterey Inn
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 500 Martin Street, Monterey, CA 93940"Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- hotel. 40-450.

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - Old Monterey Inn
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 500 Martin Street, Monterey, CA 93940

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - Pacific Grove
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56"Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- site. Butterfly Town, U.S.A., resting stop for 10,000 of Monarch butterflies.

properties.name: Monterey Peninsula - Pebble Beach Golf Links
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56  "Sacred Golf, Nature\'s Wonderama, and All That Jazz"- site. One of the most spectacular tournamant class public courses in the world. 75.

properties.name: Monuments of Oviedo and the Kingdom of the    Asturias
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 In the 9th century the flame of Christianity was kept alive in the Iberian peninsula in the tiny Kingdom of the Asturias. Here an innovative pre-Romanesque architectural style was created that was to play a significant role in the development of the religious architecture of the peninsula. Its highest achievements can be seen in the churches of Santa María del Naranco, San Miguel de Lillo, Santa Cristina de Lena, the Cámara Santa and San Julián de los Prados, in and around the ancient capital city of Oviedo. Associated with them is the remarkable contemporary hydraulic engineering structure known as La Foncalada.

properties.name: Mrs. Wilkes's Boarding House
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56107 W. Jones St., Savannah, GA 31401"Quintessential Comfort Food"- restaurant, lunch M-F (3), no reservations (arrive at 10:45). No charge cards.

properties.name: Mudejar Architecture of Aragon
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The development in the 12th century of Mudejar art in Aragon resulted from the particular political, social and cultural conditions that prevailed in Spain after the Reconquista. This art, influenced by Islamic tradition, also reflects various contemporary European styles, particularly the Gothic. Present until the early 17th century, it is characterized by an extremely refined and inventive use of brick and glazed tiles in architecture, especially in the belfries.

properties.name: Muracci's Japanese Curry and Grill
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 307 Kearny St, San Francisco, CAKatsu curry

properties.name: Museum Calouste Gulbenkian
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Av. de Berna 45A, 1067-001 Lisboa1000 - A Billionaire\'s Art Collection in Its Own Museum -site (Museum) -Closed Mondays

properties.name: My Tofu House
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 4627 Geary Blvd, San Francisco, CATofu soup with kimchi

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 222 Fifth Avenue South, Nashville, TN 37203"A City That Lives and Breathes Music"- site, event. Lots of memorabilia. 0.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 2802 Opryland Drive, Nashville, TN 37214 "A City That Lives and Breathes Music"- site, event. Great country performances Fri-Sat, extras in summer months; 6-4.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Nashville, TN"A City That Lives and Breathes Music"- site, event. Annual country music festival - June.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56  8400 Hwy 100, Nashville, TN"A City That Lives and Breathes Music"- site, event. Great country ham and egg breakfast. 7am-9pm.

properties.name: Nick's Crispy Tacos
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1500 Broadway, San Francisco, CABaja-style fish tacos

properties.name: North Shore
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Waikiki and Beyond - Stretches from Haleiwa to Kahuku (including Waimea Bay, Sunset Beach, and the Banzai Pipeline) - the world\'s best surfing during the winter.

properties.name: Obidos
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1000 - The Town That Belonged to the Queens of Portugal -town (Obidos) -hotel (Pousada do Castelo)

properties.name: Old City of Salamanca
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 This ancient university town north-west of Madrid was first conquered by the Carthaginians in the 3rd century B.C. It then became a Roman settlement before being ruled by the Moors until the 11th century. The university, one of the oldest in Europe, reached its high point during Salamanca\'s golden age. The city\'s historic centre has important Romanesque, Gothic, Moorish, Renaissance and Baroque monuments. The Plaza Mayor, with its galleries and arcades, is particularly impressive.

properties.name: Old Town of Cáceres
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The city\'s history of battles between Moors and Christians is reflected in its architecture, which is a blend of Roman, Islamic, Northern Gothic and Italian Renaissance styles. Of the 30 or so towers from the Muslim period, the Torre del Bujaco is the most famous.

properties.name: Old Town of Segovia and its Aqueduct
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The Roman aqueduct of Segovia, probably built c. A.D. 50, is remarkably well preserved. This impressive construction, with its two tiers of arches, forms part of the setting of the magnificent historic city of Segovia. Other important monuments include the Alcázar, begun around the 11th century, and the 16th-century Gothic cathedral.

properties.name: Old Town of Ávila with its Extra-Muros Churches
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Founded in the 11th century to protect the Spanish territories from the Moors, this \'City of Saints and Stones\', the birthplace of St Teresa and the burial place of the Grand Inquisitor Torquemada, has kept its medieval austerity. This purity of form can still be seen in the Gothic cathedral and the fortifications which, with their 82 semicircular towers and nine gates, are the most complete in Spain.

properties.name: Ono Hawaiian Foods
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56726 Kapahulu Ave, Honolulu, HIWaikiki and Beyond - A favorite local dive featuring island dishes

properties.name: Palau de la Música Catalana and Hospital de Sant Pau,    Barcelona
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 These are two of the finest contributions to Barcelona\'s architecture by the Catalan art nouveau architect Lluís Domènech i Montaner. The Palau de la Música Catalana is an exuberant steel-framed structure full of light and space, and decorated by many of the leading designers of the day. The Hospital de Sant Pau is equally bold in its design and decoration, while at the same time perfectly adapted to the needs of the sick.

properties.name: Palmeral of Elche
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The Palmeral of Elche, a landscape of groves of date palms, was formally laid out, with elaborate irrigation systems, at the time the Muslim city of Elche was erected, towards the end of the tenth century A.C., when much of the Iberian peninsula was Arab. The Palmeral is an oasis, a system for agrarian production in arid areas. It is also a unique example of Arab agricultural practices on the European continent. Cultivation of date palms in Elche is known at least since the Iberian times, dating around the fifth century B.C.

properties.name: Poblet Monastery
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 This Cistercian abbey in Catalonia is one of the largest in Spain. At its centre is a 12th-century church. The austere, majestic monastery, which has a fortified royal residence and contains the pantheon of the kings of Catalonia and Aragon, is an impressive sight.

properties.name: Prehistoric Rock-Art Sites in the Côa Valley
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 This exceptional concentration of rock carvings from the Upper Palaeolithic (22,000–10,000 B.C.) is the most outstanding example of early human artistic activity in this form anywhere in the world.

properties.name: Pyrénées - Mont Perdu
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 This outstanding mountain landscape, which spans the contemporary national borders of France and Spain, is centred around the peak of Mount Perdu, a calcareous massif that rises to 3,352 m. The site, with a total area of 30,639 ha, includes two of Europe\'s largest and deepest canyons on the Spanish side and three major cirque walls on the more abrupt northern slopes with France, classic presentations of these geological landforms. The site is also a pastoral landscape reflecting an agricultural way of life that was once widespread in the upland regions of Europe but now survives only in this part of the Pyrénées. Thus it provides exceptional insights into past European society through its landscape of villages, farms, fields, upland pastures and mountain roads.

properties.name: Range
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 842 Valencia St, San Francisco, CACoffee-rubbed pork shoulder

properties.name: Red Rock Country
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56An Enchanting High-Desert Terrain and Its Oasis of Luxury - more than 80 Westerns have been filmed in the surrounding countryside.

properties.name: Red Rock Country - Enchantment Resort
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56525 Boyton Canyon Road, Sedona, AZAn Enchanting High-Desert Terrain and Its Oasis of Luxury - hotel and excellent restaurant, perfectly insinuated into the desert melieu.

properties.name: Renaissance Monumental Ensembles of Úbeda and    Baeza
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The urban morphology of the two small cities of Úbeda and Baeza in southern Spain dates back to the Moorish 9th century and to the Reconquista in the 13th century. An important development took place in the 16th century, when the cities were subject to renovation along the lines of the emerging Renaissance. This planning intervention was part of the introduction into Spain of new humanistic ideas from Italy, which went on to have a great influence on the architecture of Latin America.

properties.name: Rock Art of the Mediterranean Basin on the Iberian    Peninsula
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The late prehistoric rock-art sites of the Mediterranean seaboard of the Iberian peninsula form an exceptionally large group. Here the way of life during a critical phase of human development is vividly and graphically depicted in paintings whose style and subject matter are unique.

properties.name: Roman Walls of Lugo
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The walls of Lugo were built in the later part of the 3rd century to defend the Roman town of Lucus. The entire circuit survives intact and is the finest example of late Roman fortifications in western Europe.

properties.name: Roswell - International UFO Museum and Research Center
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56114 N Main St, Roswell, NMUFO Capital of the World - Wacky UFO museum.

properties.name: Roswell - Roswell UFO Festival
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56912 N Main St, Roswell, NMUFO Capital of the World - convention is over July 4th weekend (July 3 - 6, 2008)

properties.name: Route 66
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56Rediscovering the Mother Road - It is in Albuquerque that one of the longest stretches of America\'s quintessential Main Street can still be traced.

properties.name: Route 66 - Blue Swallow Motel
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56815 Route 66 Blvd, Tucumcari, NMRediscovering the Mother Road - This motel is across the road from Tepee Curios!

properties.name: Route 66 - El Rancho Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl561000 E. Hwy 66, Gallup, NM, USA 87301Rediscovering the Mother Road - In Gallup, a location-ideal Western film capital from 1929 to 1964.

properties.name: Route 66 - El Vado Motel
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56  2500 Central S.W., Albuquerque, NMRediscovering the Mother Road - Can\'t actually stay at this motel- it was purchased by a developer to be torn down, and the city recently bought it.

properties.name: Route of Santiago de Compostela
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Santiago de Compostela was proclaimed the first European Cultural itinerary by the Council of Europe in 1987. This route from the French-Spanish border was – and still is – taken by pilgrims to Santiago de Compostela. Some 1,800 buildings along the route, both religious and secular, are of great historic interest. The route played a fundamental role in encouraging cultural exchanges between the Iberian peninsula and the rest of Europe during the Middle Ages. It remains a testimony to the power of the Christian faith among people of all social classes and from all over Europe.

properties.name: Roy's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl566600 Kalanianaole Hwy., Honolulu, HI Waikiki and Beyond - Hawaii\'s biggest success story - local fine dining.

properties.name: Royal Hawaiian
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl562259 Kalakaua Ave., Honolulu, HIWaikiki and Beyond - "Pink Palace of the Pacific", its beachside bar serves the best mai tai in town and its famous Monday Luau is a classic.

properties.name: Royal Monastery of Santa María de Guadalupe
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The monastery is an outstanding repository of four centuries of Spanish religious architecture. It symbolizes two significant events in world history that occurred in 1492: the Reconquest of the Iberian peninsula by the Catholic Kings and Christopher Columbus\' arrival in the Americas. Its famous statue of the Virgin became a powerful symbol of the Christianization of much of the New World.

properties.name: Sagrada Familia
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Barcelona, Spain1000 - One of Spain\'s Most Extraordinary Buildings -site (uncompleted work of Antoni Gaudi)

properties.name: Salamanca's Plaza Mayor
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 PASEO RECTOR ESPERABÉ 10, 37008 SALAMANCA, Spain1000 - Spain\'s Most Beautiful Square -town (Salamanca) -site (Plaza Mayor) -hotel (Hotel Rector)

properties.name: San Cristóbal de La Laguna
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 San Cristóbal de La Laguna, in the Canary Islands, has two nuclei: the original, unplanned Upper Town; and the Lower Town, the first ideal \'city-territory\' laid out according to philosophical principles. Its wide streets and open spaces have a number of fine churches and public and private buildings dating from the 16th to the 18th century.

properties.name: San Millán Yuso and Suso Monasteries
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The monastic community founded by St Millán in the mid-6th century became a place of pilgrimage. A fine Romanesque church built in honour of the holy man still stands at the site of Suso. It was here that the first literature was produced in Castilian, from which one of the most widely spoken languages in the world today is derived. In the early 16th century the community was housed in the fine new monastery of Yuso, below the older complex; it is still a thriving community today.

properties.name: San Sebastian
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Paseo Republica Argentina 4, 20004 San Sebastian, Spain1000 - A Coastal Belle Epoque Setting Fit for a Queen - Town (San Sebastian) - Hotel (Hotel Maria Cristina) - Restaurant (Arzak)

properties.name: Sanibel and Captiva Islands - Bailey-Matthews Shell Museum
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 3075 Sanibel-Captiva Road, Sanibel, FL 33957 "Bonanza Beaches for the Shell Happy"- island, site, hotel. The only museum in the country dedicated solely to shells. , open daily 10am-5pm. Best times- Nov-May for weather and bird-watching, May-mid-Jul for tarpon season.

properties.name: Sanibel and Captiva Islands - Boca Grande (Gasparilla Island)
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56131 1st St, Boca Grande, FL"Bonanza Beaches for the Shell Happy"- island, site, hotel. Boca Grande is the capital of tarpon fishing.

properties.name: Sanibel and Captiva Islands - Cabbage Key
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56"Bonanza Beaches for the Shell Happy"- island, site, hotel. 100-acre, down-home, real-life Margaritaville. Best times Nov-May.

properties.name: Sanibel and Captiva Islands - Cayo Costa State Park
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 "Bonanza Beaches for the Shell Happy"-island, site, hotel. Uninhabited barefoot Eden, arguably best shelling. Open daily, 8am-sundown. Honor /person admission fee. Best times Nov-May.

properties.name: Sanibel and Captiva Islands - J.N. Ding Darling National Wildlife Refuge
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1 Wildlife Drive, Sanibel, FL 33957"Bonanza Beaches for the Shell Happy"- island, site, hotel. Bird-watching at its finest. Closed Fridays, entrance fee is per vehicle. Best times Nov-May for bird watching.

properties.name: Sanibel and Captiva Islands - Useppa Island
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56"Bonanza Beaches for the Shell Happy"- island, site, hotel. Gatsby-esque enclave. Seafood lunches at Collier Inn (also overnight). From 60-70, dinner 5. Best times Nov-May.

properties.name: Santiago de Compostela (Old Town)
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 This famous pilgrimage site in north-west Spain became a symbol in the Spanish Christians\' struggle against Islam. Destroyed by the Muslims at the end of the 10th century, it was completely rebuilt in the following century. With its Romanesque, Gothic and Baroque buildings, the Old Town of Santiago is one of the world\'s most beautiful urban areas. The oldest monuments are grouped around the tomb of St James and the cathedral, which contains the remarkable Pórtico de la Gloria.

properties.name: Savannah's Historic District - Davenport House Museum
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 324 E. State Street, Savannah, GA 31401"Strolling Through a Romance Novel Set in the Old South"- Museum in Savannah\'s historic district - site; M-Sat 10am-4pm, Sun 1pm-4pm; admission.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56220 East Gaston Street, Savannah, GA 31401"Strolling Through a Romance Novel Set in the Old South"- Bed and breakfast in Savannah\'s Historic District- site, hotel. Also has legendary Southern breakfast. Best times to visit Savannah: late March or mid May.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56   1300 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139 "Art Deco Darling on the American Riviera" - site, hotel, restaurant. Best place to people watch on SoBe.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56   1001 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139"Art Deco Darling on the American Riviera" - site, hotel, restaurant. 90 minute walking tours depart Wed, Fri, Sat and Sun at 10:30am, Thurs at 6:30 pm - 0.

properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56  1220 Ocean Drive, Miami Beach, FL 33139"Art Deco Darling on the American Riviera" - site, hotel, restaurant. Doubles from 95-525. Restaurant is 1220 at the Tides - 00. Best times - 2d weekend in Jan for Art Deco Weekend.

properties.name: Tartine Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 600 Guerrero Street, San Francisco, CA, 94110Morning bun

properties.name: Teide National Park
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Situated on the island of Tenerife, Teide National Park features the Teide-Pico Viejo stratovolcano that, at 3,718 m, is the highest peak on Spanish soil. Rising 7,500 m above the ocean floor, it is regarded as the world’s third-tallest volcanic structure and stands in a spectacular environment. The visual impact of the site is all the greater due to atmospheric conditions that create constantly changing textures and tones in the landscape and a ‘sea of clouds’ that forms a visually impressive backdrop to the mountain. Teide is of global importance in providing evidence of the geological processes that underpin the evolution of oceanic islands.

properties.name: Ten Thousand Waves
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl563451 Hyde Park Road, santa fe new mexicoTaking the Waters Under the Stars - hotel centered around outdoor traditional Japanese hot-springs. There are also day rates.

properties.name: The Alahambra and Parador de San Francisco
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 1000 - What Wonders Lie Within -site (Alahambra) -hotel (Parador de San Francisco) -event (International Music and Dance Festival, June 25-Jul 12)

properties.name: The Boulders Resort and Golden Door Spa
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl5634631 N Tom Darlington Dr, Carefree, AZA High-Desert Resort Where Golf Rules - hotel. Very lux.

properties.name: The Breakers

properties.name: Tower of Hercules
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 The Tower of Hercules has served as a lighthouse and landmark at the entrance of La Coruña harbour in north-western Spain since the late 1st century A.D. when the Romans built the Farum Brigantium. The Tower, built on a 57 metre high rock, rises a further 55 meters. It is divided into three progressively smaller levels, the first of which corresponds to the Roman structure of the lighthouse. Immediately adjacent to the base of the Tower, is a small rectangular Roman building. The site also features a sculpture park, the Monte dos Bicos rock carvings from the Iron Age and a Muslim cemetery. The Roman foundations of the building were revealed in excavations conducted in the 1990s. Many legends from the Middle Ages to the 19th century surround the Tower of Hercules which is unique as it is the only lighthouse of Greco-Roman antiquity to have retained a measure of structural integrity and functional continuity.

properties.name: University and Historic Precinct of Alcalá de    Henares
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Founded by Cardinal Jiménez de Cisneros in the early 16th century, Alcalá de Henares was the world\'s first planned university city. It was the original model for the Civitas Dei (City of God), the ideal urban community which Spanish missionaries brought to the Americas. It also served as a model for universities in Europe and elsewhere.

properties.name: Villa Vizcaya

properties.name: Vizcaya Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Vizcaya Bridge straddles the mouth of the Ibaizabal estuary, west of Bilbao. It was designed by the Basque architect Alberto de Palacio and completed in 1893. The 45-m-high bridge with its span of 160 m, merges 19th-century ironworking traditions with the then new lightweight technology of twisted steel ropes. It was the first bridge in the world to carry people and traffic on a high suspended gondola and was used as a model for many similar bridges in Europe, Africa and the America only a few of which survive. With its innovative use of lightweight twisted steel cables, it is regarded as one of the outstanding architectural iron constructions of the Industrial Revolution.

properties.name: Works of Antoni Gaudi
properties.description: Posted by Sarahl56 Seven properties built by the architect Antoni Gaudí (1852–1926) in or near Barcelona testify to Gaudí’s exceptional creative contribution to the development of architecture and building technology in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. These monuments represent an eclectic, as well as a very personal, style which was given free reign in the design of gardens, sculpture and all decorative arts, as well as architecture. The seven buildings are: Casa Vicens; Gaudí’s work on the Nativity façade and Crypt of La Sagrada Familia; Casa Batlló; Crypt in Colonia Güell.
